name: Castleton Hotel

reviews.text: I am conflicted in my review of this hotel. Stayed in room G03 for 3 nights in October, my first reaction was "what a super tiny room!". Tried to take some photos of the room, but had very little space to do so. However, I have to say that the room is very very clean, and the single bed, extra comfy. Considering that the bed is just separated from the street by a wall; it was generally noisy, and the room being the just beside reception, can hear people talking outside, well, considering all that, I managed to sleep very well indeed. The bathroom was small too, but on the whole squeaky clean! Looking at the fire exit floor plan, it appears that G03 is the smallest room on that floor, but I guess a room on the groud floor is much better than that in lower ground.
reviews.title: Very very small room, but very clean rooms!

reviews.text: My sister and I had requested a twin bed room. It was more like a twin bed cupboard with a little room between the beds. It was tiny but this is London so it wasn't too much of an issue. We were very concerned that the minuscule bathroom, similar to a ferry or a caravan emitted a dreadful odour. We were unable to shower in June room or leave the door open as the stench was too great. It smelt of drains and raw sewage and made both of us feel quite sick. We approached to desk and were told they would fix it, it improved a little then went back to the original state. We were then told we would be moved. It was just to placate us they didn't care. All three men at the desk told us the same thing but nothing was done. Then we were told that there were no more rooms available. One day we were told to pack and our things would be moved, of inure this didn't happen. It was rude and insulting to be treated so badly in London, the staff did not care and didn't help us at all. I will never stay there again.
reviews.title: Don't bother coming here!!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel one night Sun 6th October. This was my 5th visit to the hotel in the past couple of years. The front of house staff / duty managers I have met have always been very pleasant to talk to and helpful. Received a warm welcome on arrival. Hotel is in a very convenient location. The room was a little dark possibly due to it's location within the building and there was a bit of noise from the heating system units outside, but not a huge problem and no outside street noise. More importantly I have found the rooms (so far stayed in 402, L109, L112, 201 and g09), bedding and towels to be very clean. Rooms very spacious and not too warm but not too cold either. The bed was comfortable. The ''pod'' / modular style compact shower rooms are brilliant - ideal for one person and superb shower water temperature quality and flow. Easy to keep tidy and non-slip flooring. Could do with one at home! A nice quiet hotel - very little noise from outside and other rooms above. I like the breakfast room and that classic fm radio was on in the background. The breakfast food was freshly cooked and the breakfast staff worked very hard to ensure guests received tea / coffee and toast as quickly as possible. Tip: go to breakfast early (a note in the lift gives the times). In fact this time the lady had brought coffee and toast as soon as I sat down! Choice of breakfast items is ok. The hotel communal downstairs rooms, corridors, reception area is well maintained and the lift is a nice modern one. The cleaning, reception, breakfast and other staff work hard and do their best to ensure guests are looked after. As a single female traveller I always feel safe in this hotel, it is nice having the benefit of 24 hour staffed front desk and telephone in the room just in case.
reviews.title: Another comfortable enjoyable visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First surprise was that I specifically asked for a double bed when did my reservation, only to find twin ones.....when asked for a change i was told there was no availability (I found this a lack of ethics from them). On top of that, each bed had a different size being one of them even smaller than a standard twin. The room was extremely small (i read similar reviews like this one myself, but could never imagine they are thatr small),....we could barely leave the luggage.Also, there was no chair, no desk, no minibar, no nothing in it (since there was no space), and the bathroom was the size- and qualities- of an airplane toilett. In all honestly, having paid 170 GBP for one night, I felt ripped off.
reviews.title: Not worth the money at all.

reviews.text: Just at the end of the street is the huge Paddington Station. I stayed at the Castleton Hotel for over two weeks unintentionally... The accommodation I had booked from Australia had fallen through because I'd used an Australian credit card (they wanted a British card) when I arrived at Heathrow Airport my iphone battery was dead. so I asked a black taxi to take me somewhere centrally located. I was about to embark on rental property hunting in nearby W2, so it was all quite sporadic and chaotic. Meanwile, I had about 3-4 different rooms, they were all single rooms (small) they all varied in size marginally. They were all consistantly clean though. My room price varied depending on who had booked ahead, what was available + their evening rate. By the time I'd left I had begun to know all the staff and I recommend the place highly, they were all lovely. One of the best parts for me was the breakfasts, they were huge!
reviews.title: CASTLETON - GREAT LOCATION.

reviews.text: This hotel has good value for the money you pay. It is clean and comfortable. Of course, the rooms, including the bathrooms, are very small but that is quite usual for London. The bathrooms seem like they are ship bathrooms fitted afterwards, but they do there job.
reviews.title: Good prices for a small but clean room, at a great location

reviews.text: I've been to this hotel several times and the service and accomodation are consistent. At least I know what to expect: good prices for a small but clean room, at a great location near Paddington Station.
reviews.title: Another Stay @ Castleton; Bumpy Start

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 2 nights at the Castleton Hotel, not my first stay. Yes, the rooms (I've had singles) are quite small, but they do have a chair and nightstand in the room, not just a bed (as in some other budget hotels I've tried in London).
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: Had a bit of a bumpy experience this time as the first evening I checked in the elevator/lift stopped on a floor I did not want with a hard bounce, then proceeded to the reception/ground floor. I told the manager on duty, who said the lift had been worked on earlier in the day, but they would call back the technician. The next day I had a much bigger scare in the lift as it stopped and bounced between two floors I had not selected before I finally was able to exit on the reception/ground floor, then hike upstairs to my room. I again spoke to the manager on duty. I decided I wasn't comfortable having a room on an upper floor with what I felt to be an unreliable lift, and requested that the manager move me to a lower floor. After a couple requests, the manager did agree to give me a lower floor room for my last night.
reviews.title: Tiny room and bathroom, not worth staying
Simple and great location!
reviews.text: Stayed for one night in the Castleton in a quad room as there were four of us going to a concert.
It was perfect for what we needed, 2 minutes from the station, somewhere to put our heads down.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure

reviews.text: Not sure i would stay again if I was staying for more than one night, but perfect when on a budget. Reception staff very helpful and breakfast was brilliant.
reviews.title: Nice furnishings, friendly, room disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend for quick stopover.
reviews.title: Small but adequate

reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed at the Castleton Hotel and it is always a pleasure. The staff are very friendly and helpful and nothing is too much of a problem. Each room has its own airconditioner so you can adjust it as you like. On the cooler days, the staff turn it on for you so that when you return to the room it is already warm. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you are single and female. So close to Paddington train station and accessible to banks, shops and the rest of London.
reviews.title: Good location but freezing and noisy.

reviews.text: Very kind welcome, the staff were always friendly and ready to help.
reviews.title: Good location, small but clean.

reviews.text: Breakfast was a buffet style of beans, bacon, egg and toast. Tea/coffee and an orange juice.
reviews.title: Just location
For sailing boat lovers
reviews.text: We stayed in a twin room and it was what to be expected, quite small. Small TV in the room, but for us, coming to London wasn't to watch TV. Wifi was good. The bathroom consisted of a shower, basin and toilet. All very clean.
We unfortunately only had a view of the air conditioning unit, which did hum in the night but luckily didn't disturb us.
reviews.title: visit to london

reviews.text: VERY close to Paddington Tube station, about 2 minute walk.
reviews.title: Bed bugs

reviews.text: What a great little hotel. This place has everything necessary. My tiny single room in the basement amazingly had everything - AC, TV, ensuite ( literally, at the end of the bed ) tea & coffee, free wifi & a window. It took me 20 minutes from T5, probably quicker than most of the airport hotels to get to, and at such a great price (late rooms ) that I'm sorry I didn't find it earlier.
reviews.title: great hotel 20mins from T5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast, great rate, great location, and they will keep your bags - will definitely book again ( with the 5% discount they sent this morning ).
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Good hotel and service. Location just across Paddington station and within walking distance. Bathroom is a bit small for a big guy like me. Good hotel and service. Location just across Paddington station and within walking distance. Bathroom is a bit small for a big guy like me.
reviews.title: My Review is what I saw (People have different opinions)

reviews.text: I made reservations for this hotel and in the arrival section said 9:00am. I got there at 9 and my room wasn't ready. They held my bags while I went out to see the city. At 2 when I went to the hotel, I went up to my room. I was very surprised at the fact they had an elevator. I was on the top floor. My room was very small, however enough for me. It had a bed, tv, air con, ensuite, window. The bathroom was like an aeroplane bathroom with a tiny shower added to it. The water was temperamental and on occasions went in and out of pressure and heat (but nothing bad enough to complain about and this was the only negative thing) They have wifi which is a bonus! The location was excellent. About a 2 minute walk to the underground. And there is also a direct fast train from Heathrow to Paddington (Didnt know about it until the end) There are fast food restaurants and other places to eat near by. I would definitely stay here again. It was very homely.
reviews.title: Great, budget hotel
Less than good
reviews.text: If the rooms would cost 30€, I would had gave it 5 stars. I paid 206€ for 1 night. Certainly the rooms might not be all at the same level, however mines was smelling mouldy and measly. It is true that the room and bath looked clean but everything inside was cheapest of cheapest. The view made me think at a dwelling from suburbs of New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It might be a cultural misunderstanding, but breathing cheap air for 25€ per hour it's a very high price, even for UK.
reviews.title: Good value & location for money

reviews.text: The only advantage of this hotel is the location - 3 min walking to Paddington station.
reviews.title: Oh dear.....

reviews.text: Booked this hotel as we were going to radio 2 Live in Hyde Park and the location was perfect.
reviews.title: Shocking!

reviews.text: With the extremely high prices for London accommodations, the Castleton Hotel was a great find and the room rate included wifi and a full English breakfast served 7am-9am which we made one day and missed the next. The location is great; two minutes walk from Paddington underground station and it was wonderful after a long day of sightseeing to only have to walk minutes before getting home. The street is also very busy with lots of restaurants and bars so you feel safe and in the middle of things. Check in was quick and the reception staff were helpful and friendly throughout the stay. Our twin room was small but sufficient; clean and cosy. The shower/toilet was like a pod which met our needs but am not sure if a larger person would be able to use either properly. Felt a bit cold at night because summer had not yet arrived but we put on the airconditioner to 29 degrees which helped warm us up. Would definitely come back here again.
reviews.title: Good value for money
Great value for London hotel
reviews.text: Staying at the Castleton at the moment and finding everything good. Typical small London hotel with small rooms and narrow stairwells but the lift makes life easy. Room is clean and bed is comfy. Breakfast is basic buffet style with bacon, sausage, eggs, tomato and beans. Fills you up for the day. Close to the tube station and bus lines. Ticks all the boxes.

Though this hotel is in a great location, a block from Paddington Station and two blocks from Hyde park, don't bother. The beds were small and I could feel every spring. The retrofit baths smelled like a porta potty and felt like something from a cheap RV.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in a triple room during the Paralympics. Had a good stay overall, since the hotel has an excellent location, within a very short walk to 2 underground stations and Hyde Park, with lots of restaurants, fast-food joints and mini-markets down London Street.
reviews.title: No-frills and good value (for London)

reviews.text: The room was tiny - something to be expected in London for this price range. The bathroom was minuscule - those pre-fabs that barely fit one adult, but functional. Beds were ok, the window was soundproofed and there is enough space for one medium bag on the floor - but not much more.
reviews.title: Pretty good value for London

reviews.text: This hotel is located in the heart of paddington and is walking distance to all shops and stores. It is very clean and relatively cheap making it more favorable to tourists. The staff were helpful and friendly. On the other hand, the rooms were rather small and the ac made a drilling noise every once and a while during my stay. Hope they fix that problem. But overall this is a very good hotel for its price and location.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: I loved this hotel, price is good for center of london, clean comfortable and nice cooked breakfast. atmsophere is pleasant, bathrooms clean. very good for a 3 star hotel and exellent location, very near paddington station, cafes, two streets away from oxford street. i would definitely stay here again. staff great. Free WIFI and Breakfast and AC. great deal.
reviews.title: Very cute little hotel, just perfect

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night having arrived from Singapore. If you are traveling to/from Paddington this is a great place to stay. The room was small but clean and tidy. The ensuite was interesting as it felt a bit like being in a camper van but it worked perfectly well. The breakfast was what you would expect in a small UK hotel. The free Wifi was a bonus with checking travel plans.
reviews.title: Excellent location, room not large - but fine

reviews.text: Clean clean room and bathroom, if you are looking for a simple straight forward place to sleep on the move, this is okay. Has acc in room that rattled all night. Otherwise no complains. Good value for the money.
reviews.title: Very reasonable for the location

reviews.text: I stayed in Castleton Hotel with my parents for 4 nights and we just loved the place! The hotel is clean and in a very nice neighborhood! Staff are so great and helpful!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

description: One of the best value Paddington Hotels, and situated in the heart of London Paddington, The Castleton Hotel is the ideal base for exploring the capital. Located very close to Hyde Park, many of London's most famous attractions are within walking distance and Paddington Station, with its excellent transport links, is just a short walk away. The Heathrow Express train from Paddington can transport you to Heathrow Airport in only 15 minutes.The Castleton Hotel offers 46 rooms, all with en-suite bathroom, air-conditioning, central heating, satellite television, lift access and telephone. Our rooms can accommodate a single person from 45GBP per night and up to four people from 89GBP per night, inclusive of a generous cooked English breakfast and all taxes.With comfortable rooms to ensure a restful night's sleep, and friendly staff available around the clock to offer whatever assistance you might require during your stay, The Castleton Hotel offers excellent value for money.We look forward to welcoming you to The Castleton - the ideal London Paddington Hotel.
